org.dataconservancy.packaging.gui.presenter

Interface PackageDescriptionPresenter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Presenter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PackageDescriptionPresenterImpl

    public interface PackageDescriptionPresenter
extends Presenter
    This presenter controls the display of the package description view. It also handles validating a package description, before a package is allowed to be created. *

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canCollapseParentArtifact(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageArtifact packageArtifact)
      Determines whether the current artifact can be attached to its grandparent artifact, essentially cutting off its parent from the of artifact.
      void changeType(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageArtifact packageArtifact, String type)
      Changes the type of the provided artifact to the provided type.
      void collapseParentArtifact(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageArtifact packageArtifact)
      Collapses synthesized DI + F pair into MdF for the containing collection
      void displayPackageTree()
      Refresh the display of a new PackageTree.
      List<String> findInvalidProperties(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageArtifact packageArtifact, String type)
      Goes through all the artifacts in the package description and finds any properties that aren't valid.
      javafx.scene.control.TreeItem<org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageArtifact> findItem(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageArtifact packageArtifact)
      Return the TreeItem containing the given PackageArtifact or null if none found.
      Set<String> getInheritingTypes(String parentType, String propertyName)
      Given the type of the current artifact and a propertyName, this method returns a Set of names of the artifact types which can inherit the specified property fro the current artifact.
      Set<String> getValidTypes(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageArtifact packageArtifact)
      Given an artifact queries the ontology service to determine the acceptable artifact types.
      void rebuildTreeView()
      Rerun the ontology service on the PackageDescription and redisplay the resulting PackageTree.
      void setPackageDescriptionBuilder(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageDescriptionBuilder packageDescriptionBuilder)
      Used to serialize the package description, for saving to a file.
      void setPackageDescriptionValidator(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.impl.PackageDescriptionValidator packageDescriptionValidator)
      Used to validate the package description before the user is allowed to move on to generating a package.
      void setPackageOntologyService(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.api.PackageOntologyService packageOntologyService)
      Sets the ontology service that is used for determining property and relationship types, as well as acceptable artifact types.
      void trimInvalidProperties(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageDescription packageDescription)
      Trims out invalid and empty properties from the package description, primarily before serializing, to keep it clean and uncluttered.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.dataconservancy.packaging.gui.presenter.Presenter

        display, getController, setController, setErrors, setInternalProperties, setLabels, setMessages

    • Method Detail

      • setPackageOntologyService

        void setPackageOntologyService(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.api.PackageOntologyService packageOntologyService)
        Sets the ontology service that is used for determining property and relationship types, as well as acceptable artifact types.
        Parameters:
        packageOntologyService - the PackageOntologyService

      • getValidTypes

        Set<String> getValidTypes(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageArtifact packageArtifact)
        Given an artifact queries the ontology service to determine the acceptable artifact types.
        Parameters:
        packageArtifact - The artifact to check for available types.
        Returns:
        The set of acceptable types for the artifact.

      • setPackageDescriptionBuilder

        void setPackageDescriptionBuilder(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageDescriptionBuilder packageDescriptionBuilder)
        Used to serialize the package description, for saving to a file.
        Parameters:
        packageDescriptionBuilder - The package description builder to use for serialization.

      • setPackageDescriptionValidator

        void setPackageDescriptionValidator(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.impl.PackageDescriptionValidator packageDescriptionValidator)
        Used to validate the package description before the user is allowed to move on to generating a package. Validation is only performed when this presenter is being exited, we don't validate before saving a description.
        Parameters:
        packageDescriptionValidator - the PackageDescriptionValidator

      • changeType

        void changeType(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageArtifact packageArtifact,
                String type)
        Changes the type of the provided artifact to the provided type.
        Parameters:
        packageArtifact - The artifact to change the type of.
        type - The new type of the artifact.

      • trimInvalidProperties

        void trimInvalidProperties(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageDescription packageDescription)
        Trims out invalid and empty properties from the package description, primarily before serializing, to keep it clean and uncluttered.
        Parameters:
        packageDescription - The package description to clean

      • findInvalidProperties

        List<String> findInvalidProperties(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageArtifact packageArtifact,
                                   String type)
        Goes through all the artifacts in the package description and finds any properties that aren't valid. This can occur when a property has been set and then artifact type has change, and the previously set property doesn't exist on the new type.
        Parameters:
        packageArtifact - the package description to look for invalid properties
        type - The type to check the properties of the artifact against, if you want to test if the artifact has invalid properties pass it's current type.
        Returns:
        A map of strings with properties that are invalid keyed by the artifact, maybe empty but never null.

      • getInheritingTypes

        Set<String> getInheritingTypes(String parentType,
                               String propertyName)
        Given the type of the current artifact and a propertyName, this method returns a Set of names of the artifact types which can inherit the specified property fro the current artifact.
        Parameters:
        parentType - the parent's Type
        propertyName - the property name
        Returns:
        a Set of name of the artifact types which can inherit the specified property fro the current artifact

      • rebuildTreeView

        void rebuildTreeView()
        Rerun the ontology service on the PackageDescription and redisplay the resulting PackageTree.

      • displayPackageTree

        void displayPackageTree()
        Refresh the display of a new PackageTree.

        javafx.scene.control.TreeItem<org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageArtifact> findItem(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageArtifact packageArtifact)
        Return the TreeItem containing the given PackageArtifact or null if none found.
        Parameters:
        packageArtifact - the PackageArtifact
        Returns:
        matching TreeItem

      • collapseParentArtifact

        void collapseParentArtifact(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageArtifact packageArtifact)
        Collapses synthesized DI + F pair into MdF for the containing collection
        Parameters:
        packageArtifact - The package artifact to collapse into a metadata file.

      • canCollapseParentArtifact

        boolean canCollapseParentArtifact(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageArtifact packageArtifact)
        Determines whether the current artifact can be attached to its grandparent artifact, essentially cutting off its parent from the of artifact.
        Parameters:
        packageArtifact - the PackageArtifact
        Returns:
        True if the artifact can be attached to a grandparent, false otherwise
